description: fetus +‎ -cide or fetus +‎ -icide, from French -cide, from Latin -cida (“cutter, killer”), from -cid (combining form of caedō (“cut, kill”)) + -a (“-er”) (used for form agent nouns).

entries.meaning: The killing of a fetus or embryo; an induced abortion. [from 19th century]
examples: Notwithstanding the earnest opposition of writers and lecturers and preachers and legislators, the practice of feticide appears to be on the increase.
